result.execSummary:
The defendant Rojelio Madrigal Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Straight time.  Concurrent to Count 3.  Court grants 126 days credit.  Sentence commencing forthwith.

Restitution to be determined at a hearing at a later date.
$750 Cash Bail on deposit to be held pending the outcome of the Restitution Hearing.

Costs to be paid as a condition of extended supervision ordered in Count 3

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. .

Concurrent to Count 1.  Court grants 126 days credit.
Defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.  Defendant IS eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

superMiscConds.notes:
Follow through with any assessments, evaluations, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent. Follow any conditions deemed appropriate by Agent.  

No contact with Victim listed in the Criminal Complaint.

Make best efforts to maintain/obtain full time employment, schooling or a combination of the two.  Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons.

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 

If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of any controlled substances without a valid doctor's prescription.
Costs to be paid during term of imprisonment and as a condition of of extended supervision..

records.addlTxt: Restitution hearing on December 7, 2022 at 11:00 am.

3:59 PM; Case called for Sentencing hearing.  Defendant Rojelio Madrigal Jr in court, in custody.  Attorney Jeffrey W. Jensen Jr. in court for Rojelio Madrigal Jr.  Prosecuting attorney Molly M Schmidt in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Court confirms with counsel they have received the PSI report and inquires if there are any additions or corrections that need to be made.  State has nothing to add or change with respect to the PSI report.  Atty. Jensen notes there is one correction to make and places it on the record.  Court will take judicial notice of that correction by defense.

Sentencing arguments made by the State.
Sentencing arguments made by Atty. Jensen.
Defendant presents statements.

COUNT 1:
The Court Orders the Following:

9 Months Jail Straight Time (Concurrent to Count 3 - 126 Days Credit).  Sentence commences immediately.

RESTITUTION: TBD at the restitution hearing scheduled for 12/7/2022.  Court will also order that the $750.00 Cash Bail on deposit be held pending the outcome of the restitution hearing. 

COSTS:  $243.00;

DNA Surcharge: $200.00;

DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 

Total costs/fine/forfeiture:  to be paid during term of imprisonment and during extended supervision as ordered in Count 3. Failure to pay;  will result in a civil judgment.



COUNT 3:
The Court Orders the Following:

4 Years & 6 Months Imprisonment (Concurrent to Count 1 - 126 Days Credit)
-	1 Year & 6 Months of Initial Confinement
-	3 Years of Extended Supervision

Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program

Conditions of Extended Supervision:
-	Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
-	Follow any conditions deemed appropriate by Agent;
-	No contact with Victim listed in the Criminal Complaint.
-	Absolute Sobriety; Random U.A.'s;
-	No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia;
-	No use or possession of any controlled substances without a valid doctor's prescription
-	Make best efforts to Maintain/Obtain full time employment, schooling, or a combination of the two;
-	Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons.

COSTS:  $268.00;

DNA Surcharge: $250.00;

DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 

Total costs/fine/forfeiture:  to be paid during term of imprisonment and during extended supervision. Failure to pay;  will result in a civil judgment.

Felony warnings, immigration warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
Restitution hearing scheduled for December 7, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Proposed Motion and Order to Seal Victim Impact Statement(s) submitted by the State.
from Victim A filed by the State.
Sentencing hearing on October 24, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Filed by Atty Jensen requesting an adjournment of today's hearing.  **Reviewed by Judge Moroney, for Branch 7, 10/17/22 - Approved for adjournment.**
Sentencing hearing on October 17, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

2:42 PM; Case called for Hearing.  Prosecuting attorney Patrick Ryan Campbell in court for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant Rojelio Madrigal Jr in court, in custody at WCJ.  Attorney Jeffrey W. Jensen Jr. in court for Rojelio Madrigal Jr.  Atty. Jensen notes he filed a plea questionnaire and believes the matter can proceed to a plea only today but will need to be adjourned for sentencing.  State confirms they have complied with victim rights to proceed with a plea only today.  Court conducts plea colloquy with the defendant.  Defendant requests a moment to discuss the matter with his attorney.  Atty. Jensen advises he and his client are prepared to proceed.  Court continues with the plea colloquy.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Counts 1 & 3, Court finds defendant guilty of Counts 1 & 3.  Court orders Counts 2 & 4 dismissed and read in.  Court also orders cases 22CF1049 & 22CM978 dismissed and read into this case.   Court notes the State is requesting a PSI.  Atty. Jensen confirms but is objecting to the request and presents statements. State responds and maintains their request for a PSI.  Court will order a PSI be prepared in this matter.  Court will adjourn for sentencing in about 45-60 days.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
